abstract: A judge in Britain rules that assets can be seized to pay off debts.
snippet: A judge in Britain rules that assets can be seized to pay off debts.
lead_paragraph: Four original members of UB40, the British reggae band that sold more than 70 million records, have been declared bankrupt by a judge in Britain, the BBC and Billboard reported. A judge in the Birmingham County court said government tax officers could seize the band's assets and property to pay off outstanding debts in a ruling against the saxophonist Brian Travers, the drummer Jimmy Brown, the trumpeter Terence Oswald and the percussionist Norman Hassan.

headline.main: Despite Millions of Record Sales, UB40 Members Are Bankrupt
